solution.text:
Breadth = _{{5*j}}_ cm
\(\Rightarrow\) Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
\(\Rightarrow\) Therefore, taking case 1, K = ( 10 \(\times\) _{j}_) \(\times\) (5 \(\times\) _{k}_ ) = 50 \(\times\) _{j}_ \(\times\) _{k}_
\(\Rightarrow\) Hence, if Length = 10 \(\times\) _{k}_
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth =\( \frac {50 \times _{j}_ \times _{k}_}{10 \times _{k}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = _{{5*j}}_

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are _{{10*j}}_ and _{{5*k}}_ cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is _{{10*k}}_
